metadata.title: CVE-2022-40617 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
strongSwan before 5.9.8 allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice in the revocation plugin by sending a crafted end-entity (andintermediate CA) certificate that contains a CRL/OCSP URL that points to aserver (under the attacker's control) that doesn't properly respond but(for example) just does nothing after the initial TCP handshake, or sendsan excessive amount of application data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-40617` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

charon-cmd - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.1
charon-systemd - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.1
libcharon-extauth-plugins - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.1
libcharon-extra-plugins - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.1
libstrongswan - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.1
libstrongswan-extra-plugins - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.1
libstrongswan-standard-plugins - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.1
strongswan - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.1
strongswan-charon - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.1
strongswan-libcharon - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.1
strongswan-nm - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.1
strongswan-pki - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.1
strongswan-scepclient - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.1
strongswan-starter - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.1
strongswan-swanctl - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: strongswan package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.9.5-2ubuntu2.1').
